text:
Respiratory failure, acute (not ARDS/[**Doctor Last Name 11**])
   Assessment:
   Pt alert. Pt nodding to questions. Able to follow commands. MAE. Right
   upper and lower extremities weaker then left. (pt had CVA in past).
   PERRL. Pt remains NSR.  K 3.9 and Mag 1.9 -> yesterday afternoon. BP
   100-110
s/40
s. + pp by doppler. LS clear with dim bases. Pt on CPAP
   50% with 8 peep and 15 PS. Pt initially tachypenic -> RR in the 30
   Pt reports feeling
anxious
 and SOB.  + bs. TF currently at 30 cc/hr
   (goal 55 cc/hr), minimal residual.  Foley draining clear yellow urine.
   Pt ~ 1400 cc
s negative at midnight. Glucose 201 last evening
   Action:
          Pt given trazodone 25 mg via PEG x 1
          Pt given 0.5 mg ativan IV x 1
          Pt given 60 meq KCL via PEG
          Pt given 2 grams mag sulfate
          Pt given 15 units lantus Sc and 6 units Humalog SC for
   glucose of 201
   Response:
   Vitals stable overnight . no effect noted after trazadone given. After
   ativan given -> the pt was able to nod that her anxiety had resolved
   and her RR was down to the 20
s. pt appeared more comfortable and was
   able to sleep.  Tolerating tube feedings
   Plan:
   Pulm toilet, diuresis, monitor lytes/glucose, monitor hemodynamics,
   advance tube feeding as ordered
